flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Making moving props out of wire and solder and servos.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Making moving props out of wire and solder and servos.

Relevant parts
  • Steel wire
  • Servo (generic)
Tools
  • jewelers Soldering Iron and rosin core solder.

lines.text: Bend wire into a loop the size of the body, making a frame.
lines.text_raw: Bend wire into a loop the size of the body, making a frame.

lines.text: Make a servo bracket out of wire and solder it to the frame.
lines.text_raw: Make a servo bracket out of wire and solder it to the frame.

lines.text: Make a hinge by loosely winding wire around the frame. Constrain by soldering blobs of solder near the hinge.
lines.text_raw: Make a hinge by loosely winding wire around the frame. Constrain by soldering blobs of solder near the hinge.

lines.text: Attach to servo horn with a section of steel cable.
lines.text_raw: Attach to servo horn with a section of steel cable.

guide.summary: I made some Pokemon.  Well, I made some Pokemon move.  The Pokemon themselves where crocheted by sam over at Sam & Rae Crafts. I made some bits of skeleton using steel wire and solder.
guide.title: Animatronic Pokemon Props

tools.text: jewelers Soldering Iron and rosin core solder.
